div.p: The Governor has extended the Ohio School Closure through May 1st. The district will provide an update on student instruction, school lunches, and other important items by the end of the week.

article.a: Learn More about School Closure Extended - May 1st

div.p: Please review this important update regarding Amherst's School Closure Plan.

article.a: Learn More about Amherst's School Closure Plan Update

div.p: Please read Superintendent Sayers's update regarding the Governor's 3-week closure of Ohio public schools and Amherst's response.

div.p: "Grab-n-Go" school lunches will be available to all Amherst students in grades K-12 at no cost. Please read this post for more information and to complete the request form for April 20th-24th.

article.a: Read more about School Lunch Request - April 20-24

div.p: "Grab-n-Go" school lunches will be available to all Amherst students in grades K-12 at no cost. Please read this post for more information and to complete the request form for April 13th-17th.

article.a: Read more about School Lunches Request April 13th-17th

div.p: The Amherst Board of Education will hold its regularly scheduled meeting on April 13th, remotely at 5:30 PM. The public may attend the meeting by viewing a live broadcast on the district YouTube Channel.

article.a: Read more about April Board Meeting Update

div.p: Steele High School students are #1 in Lorain County for college credits earned at Lorain County Community College.
The Amherst Junior High School is a National Blue Ribbon School.
Congratulations to Steele Athletics for a record-setting 7 team Southwest Conference Championships!
Amherst provides award-winning Band, Choir, Orchestra, Theatre, and Visual Arts programs.
